instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: can't find a temp sensor on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: this board has a TM0P sensor error. it's the sensor for the dc-in proximity airflow. i'm not sure which one that it is

threads.title: can't find a temp sensor on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
If you got the error code from ASD, post the entire error message.
Run ASD in Continue mode; there may be more errors.

Check if problem remains disconnecting webcam.
Also test with known good trackpad flex/board.

DCIN board is board is in the same area as LVDS connector.
Look at page 50 and guess which sensor corresponds.

Be aware, if TM0P is RAM related instead, its sensor is on the trackpad side.

threads.title: can't find a temp sensor on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: it says that it can't read it

threads.title: can't find a temp sensor on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Write signal names correctly please.
Tm0P is not the same as TM0P (which should be RAM related).

Is that the only error you get in ASD?
Did you do the above mentioned tests?

Check <TRANSISTOR>Q5502</TRANSISTOR> and its traces to <CHIP>U5570</CHIP>.
